Pratibimb as the name suggests, reflects the ideology of the group i.e to present the reflections of life on stage. The group has dedicated itself to arousing social awareness & inculcating moral and ethical values. Pratibimb firmly believes that theatre is an excellent tool to recreate a harmonious world and to make people comfortable to overcome the emerging challenges facing the society and to ease out stress.

sourceOfFunds.purpose: PROVIDING A MID MAY MEAL SCHEME TO SCHOOL CHILDREN PROVIDING A Integrated Child Development Services (ICDS) is a government programme in India which provides food, preschool education, primary healthcare, immunization, health check-up and referral services to children under 6 years of age and their mothers. The Midday Meal Scheme is a school meal programme of the Government of India designed to better the nutritional standing of school-age children nationwide.[1] The programme supplies MID MEAL

Mid Day Meal in schools has had a long history in India. In 1925, a Mid Day Meal Programme was introduced for disadvantaged children in Madras Municipal Corporation. By the mid 1980s three States viz. Gujarat, Kerala and Tamil Nadu and the UT of Pondicherry had universalized a cooked Mid Day Meal Programme with their own resources for children studying at the primary stage. By 1990-91 the number of States implementing the mid day meal programme with their own resources on a universal or a large

The intention is to empower mothers of the children covered under the programme to supervise the preparation and serving of the meal and to exercise an effective vigil. Mothers are encouraged to take turns to oversee the feeding of the children, thus ensuring quality and regularity of the meal. For this, they need to devote only a couple of hours once or twice in a month. This simple intervention of ‘mothers watch’, gives them a voice and a role and greater ownership of the programme.

In October 2007, the Scheme was extended to cover children of upper primary classes (i.e. class VI to VIII) studying in 3,479 Educationally Backwards Blocks (EBBs) and the name of the Scheme was changed from ‘National Programme of Nutritional Support to Primary Education’ to ‘National Programme of Mid Day Meal in Schools’. The nutritional norm for upper primary stage was fixed at 700 Calories and 20 grams of protein. The Scheme was extended to all areas across the country from 1.4.2008

detailsOfAchievement: Activities: Universalization of Education: To improve quality of education by running formal and non formal education centers, incorporating different innovations for all age groups with special emphasis on girl child and people living below the poverty line. To reduce the number of â€˜out of schoolâ€™ children. Community Health: To implement comprehensive community health programs with special focus on women and children. Community Organization: To organize the underprivileged into self-help groups, to facilitate them to unite for collective action to realize their rights and under-take infrastructural development for schools, parks, play-grounds etc. Work for long-term integrated community empowerment/development programmes. Socio-economic development: To identify skills, arrange training for its enhancement and support them in income generating activities to promote self-reliance in the less privileged community. To provide employment opportunities to youths as per their capability. Achievements: Educated more then 7000 and mainstreamed 2500 Children. Rasta is engaged in integrated child development, community health and women empowerment. Awareness of provisions of RTI Act has enabled marginalized community to get enforced their rights. Two projects (1 for Minority girls) exclusively for girls education are in hand. Total 770 girls are studying in our centers, out of which 300 are from minority community. Department of Education Delhi Govt. has evaluated us Grade A organization.

Doordarshan will b etelecasting the festival live while the symposium sessions will be recorded for later telecast.We will also be publsihing a journal out of the findings of the seminar. detailsOfAchievement: REACHA is a Registered Voluntary Organisation engaged in meaningful need-based community work since 1992. Do refer our wiki website at www.reacha.org for more information. Some of our main programmes can be perused at: * Safe India Campaign - Counter Terrorism for the Common Man - http://www.reacha.org/strategy-for-counter-terrorism * Strategy for Social Change - http://www.reacha.org/strategy-for-social-change * Energy Clubs with Tata Power: * Mumbai - http://www.reacha.org/tata-power-energy-club * Delhi - http://www.reacha.org/energy-clubs (in partnership with Delhi Govt).
